required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vital Signs Changes During Dental Procedures
clinical_study.official_title: Vital Signs Changes During Different Dental Procedures in Otherwise Healthy Adult Patients.

lead_sponsor.agency: Riyadh Colleges of Dentistry and Pharmacy

clinical_study.source: Riyadh Colleges of Dentistry and Pharmacy

brief_summary.textblock:
The study will evaluate the vital signs changes during 3 different dental procedures performed for the same patient by the same dentist. The patients will be selected randomly and should all be healthy adults.
The aim is to look for any significant changes in the major vital signs (heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure, peripheral capillary oxygen saturation (SpO2) and body temperature) during specified dental procedures (scaling, simple restoration, and simple exodontia) and compare the changes between the 3 procedures.

study_design_info.masking_description: The care provider was not aware of study objectives. The outcomes assessor was not involved in the data collection.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Temperature (BT) during Periodontal Therapy from the baseline BT
primary_outcome.description: Body temperature measured in Celsius using infrared non-contact digital thermometer

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Body Temperature (BT) during Operative Procedure from the baseline BT
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
primary_outcome.description: Body temperature measured in Celsius using infrared non-contact digital thermometer

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Body Temperature (BT) during Dental Extraction from the baseline BT
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
primary_outcome.description: Body temperature measured in Celsius using infrared non-contact digital thermometer

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Respiratory Rate (RR) during Periodontal Therapy from the baseline RR
primary_outcome.description: Respiratory rate is measured by observing the chest and/or abdominal movements and count the number of respirations out loud for one full minute. One respiration consists of one complete rise and fall of the chest (inhalation and exhalation of air)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Respiratory Rate (RR) during Operative Procedure from the baseline RR
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
primary_outcome.description: Respiratory rate is measured by observing the chest and/or abdominal movements and count the number of respirations out loud for one full minute. One respiration consists of one complete rise and fall of the chest (inhalation and exhalation of air)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Respiratory Rate (RR) during Dental Extraction from the baseline RR
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
primary_outcome.description: Respiratory rate is measured by observing the chest and/or abdominal movements and count the number of respirations out loud for one full minute. One respiration consists of one complete rise and fall of the chest (inhalation and exhalation of air)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Heart Rate (HR) during Periodontal Therapy from the baseline HR
primary_outcome.description: The heart rate will be recorded using a non-invasive infrared pulse oximeter placed on the patient's left index finger attached to an ambulatory digital monitor

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Heart Rate (HR) during Operative Procedure from the baseline HR
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
primary_outcome.description: The heart rate will be recorded using a non-invasive infrared pulse oximeter placed on the patient's left index finger attached to an ambulatory digital monitor

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Heart Rate (HR) during Dental Extraction from the baseline HR
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
primary_outcome.description: The heart rate will be recorded using a non-invasive infrared pulse oximeter placed on the patient's left index finger attached to an ambulatory digital monitor

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Peripheral Oxygen Saturation (SpO2) during Periodontal Therapy from the baseline SpO2
primary_outcome.description: The SpO2 will be recorded using a non-invasive infrared pulse oximeter placed on the patient's index finger attached to an ambulatory digital monitor

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Peripheral Oxygen Saturation (SpO2) during Operative Procedure from the baseline SpO2
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
primary_outcome.description: The SpO2 will be recorded using a non-invasive infrared pulse oximeter placed on the patient's index finger attached to an ambulatory digital monitor

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Peripheral Oxygen Saturation (SpO2) during Dental Extraction from the baseline SpO2
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
primary_outcome.description: The SpO2 will be recorded using a non-invasive infrared pulse oximeter placed on the patient's index finger attached to an ambulatory digital monitor

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) during Periodontal Therapy from the baseline SBP
primary_outcome.description: The blood pressure BP will be measured utilizing the NIBP (noninvasive blood pressure) measurement tool attached to an ambulatory digital monitor and recorded in mmHg

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) during Operative Procedure from the baseline SBP
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
primary_outcome.description: The blood pressure BP will be measured utilizing the NIBP (noninvasive blood pressure) measurement tool attached to an ambulatory digital monitor and recorded in mmHg

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) during Dental Extraction from the baseline SBP
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
primary_outcome.description: The blood pressure BP will be measured utilizing the NIBP (noninvasive blood pressure) measurement tool attached to an ambulatory digital monitor and recorded in mmHg

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) during Periodontal Therapy from the baseline DBP
primary_outcome.description: The blood pressure BP will be measured utilizing the NIBP (noninvasive blood pressure) measurement tool attached to an ambulatory digital monitor and recorded in mmHg MAP= (Systolic BP + 2*Diastolic BP)/3 And recorded in mmHg

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) during Operative Procedure from the baseline DBP
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
primary_outcome.description: The blood pressure BP will be measured utilizing the NIBP (noninvasive blood pressure) measurement tool attached to an ambulatory digital monitor and recorded in mmHg

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) during Dental Extraction from the baseline DBP
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
primary_outcome.description: The blood pressure BP will be measured utilizing the NIBP (noninvasive blood pressure) measurement tool attached to an ambulatory digital monitor and recorded in mmHg

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Pulse Pressure (PP) during Periodontal Therapy from the baseline PP
secondary_outcome.description: The blood pressure BP will be measured utilizing the NIBP (noninvasive blood pressure) measurement tool attached to an ambulatory digital monitor. The PP is then calculated as the systolic and diastolic blood pressure difference and recorded in mmHg

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Pulse Pressure (PP) during Operative Procedure from the baseline PP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: The blood pressure BP will be measured utilizing the NIBP (noninvasive blood pressure) measurement tool attached to an ambulatory digital monitor. The PP is then calculated as the systolic and diastolic blood pressure difference and recorded in mmHg

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Pulse Pressure (PP) during Dental Extraction from the baseline PP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: The blood pressure BP will be measured utilizing the NIBP (noninvasive blood pressure) measurement tool attached to an ambulatory digital monitor. The PP is then calculated as the systolic and diastolic blood pressure difference and recorded in mmHg

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP) during Periodontal Therapy from the baseline MAP
secondary_outcome.description: The blood pressure BP will be measured utilizing the NIBP (noninvasive blood pressure) measurement tool attached to an ambulatory digital monitor. The MAP is then calculated using the following equation: MAP= (Systolic BP + 2*Diastolic BP)/3 And recorded in mmHg

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP) during Operative Procedure from the baseline MAP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: The blood pressure BP will be measured utilizing the NIBP (noninvasive blood pressure) measurement tool attached to an ambulatory digital monitor. The MAP is then calculated using the following equation: MAP= (Systolic BP + 2*Diastolic BP)/3 And recorded in mmHg

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean Arterial Pressure (MAP) during Dental Extraction from the baseline MAP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, during anesthesia injection, intraoperative, 5-min postoperative
secondary_outcome.description: The blood pressure BP will be measured utilizing the NIBP (noninvasive blood pressure) measurement tool attached to an ambulatory digital monitor. The MAP is then calculated using the following equation: MAP= (Systolic BP + 2*Diastolic BP)/3 And recorded in mmHg

clinical_study.condition: Vital Signs Changes During Dental Procedures

intervention.description: The patient will undergo a supragingival scaling procedure without local anesthesia
The patient will undergo a simple dental restoration procedure under local anesthesia
The patient will undergo a simple dental extraction procedure under local anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patients included are the ones planned for the following 3 dental treatments in 3 separate visits to done by the same dentist: supragingival scaling without local anesthesia (LA), simple dental extraction under LA, and simple restoration under LA.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under 18 years old
- Patients with a known medical history of any systemic disease like hypertension, diabetes, and bleeding disorders
- Patients with history of cardiac surgery; including pace maker insertion
- Patients on medications
- Smokers, alcoholics, and drug abusers
- Pregnant patients
- Patients with an acute infection with or without fever
- Patients with a preoperative pain score of 4 or more on a visual analogue scale out of 10; where 0 = no pain and 10 = worst pain imaginable
- Patients with 2 or more simultaneous dental procedures per visit
- Patients with undiagnosed hypertension who are found to be hypertensive according to the World Health Organization (WHO) definition on the base-line preoperative readings

overall_official.affiliation: Riyadh Colleges of Dentistry and Pharmacy

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Riyadh Colleges of Dentistry and Pharmacy
responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery
